{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Insurance Underwriting Executive",
  "description": "MOC Consulting Limited - Our client, an Insurance and Reinsurance Broking firm, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Insurance Underwriting Executive
Job Location:&nbsp;Ikoyi, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	The successful candidate must be a self-motivated team player with expertise in handling technical operations, an aggressive drive to improve client service procedures, and ensure optimal operating efficiency across all functions of the Underwriting and Claims Unit.


Responsibilities


	Prepares and evaluates proposals/bids in line with best practices for clients across different industries;
	General underwriting and preparation of broking/other technical documents for different classes of insurance;
	Prepares pre and post renewal insurance registers for clients;
	Communicate value proposition through proposals and presentations;
	Key Account Management;
	Ensure all technical operations comply with regulatory requirements and industry standards;


Claims Processing:


	Reconciliation of underwriting accounts with various clients and underwriters;
	Ensuring prompt settlement of claims in the interest of the clients;
	Prepares monthly, quarterly and annual technical reports;
	Maintain up-to-date knowledge of market trends, policies, and regulations;
	Other insurance technical matters and general tasks assigned per time.


Requirements


	BA/BSc/HND
	Minimum of 4 years of working experience in an insurance broking firm
	Associate Member of Chartered Insurance Institute of Nigeria (ACIIN)
	Relevant technical knowledge and practical experience of underwriting and claims processes
	Customer Service Intelligence
	A self-starter and fast-learner with ability to work under minimum supervision and a multitasker
	Integrity (Inspire trust and confidence in clients and co-workers)
	Excellent communication, presentation and reporting skills
	Good interpersonal skills and ability to work well with others in teams
	Good use of Microsoft office suite (Excel, Word and PowerPoint).


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;info@moclimited.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",
  "datePosted": "2025-10-30",
  "validThrough": "2025-11-22",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "MOC Consulting"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "189606"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Insurance Underwriting Executive Job at MOC Consulting Limited




        
    

        
        MOC Consulting Limited - Our client, an Insurance and Reinsurance Broking firm, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Insurance Underwriting Executive
Job Location: Ikoyi, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	The successful candidate must be a self-motivated team player with expertise in handling technical operations, an aggressive drive to improve client service procedures, and ensure optimal operating efficiency across all functions of the Underwriting and Claims Unit.


Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Prepares and evaluates proposals/bids in line with best practices for clients across different industries;
	General underwriting and preparation of broking/other technical documents for different classes of insurance;
	Prepares pre and post renewal insurance registers for clients;
	Communicate value proposition through proposals and presentations;
	Key Account Management;
	Ensure all technical operations comply with regulatory requirements and industry standards;


Claims Processing:


	Reconciliation of underwriting accounts with various clients and underwriters;
	Ensuring prompt settlement of claims in the interest of the clients;
	Prepares monthly, quarterly and annual technical reports;
	Maintain up-to-date knowledge of market trends, policies, and regulations;
	Other insurance technical matters and general tasks assigned per time.


Requirements


	BA/BSc/HND
	Minimum of 4 years of working experience in an insurance broking firm
	Associate Member of Chartered Insurance Institute of Nigeria (ACIIN)
	Relevant technical knowledge and practical experience of underwriting and claims processes
	Customer Service Intelligence
	A self-starter and fast-learner with ability to work under minimum supervision and a multitasker
	Integrity (Inspire trust and confidence in clients and co-workers)
	Excellent communication, presentation and reporting skills
	Good interpersonal skills and ability to work well with others in teams
	Good use of Microsoft office suite (Excel, Word and PowerPoint).


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: info@moclimited.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

title: Job Openings at Risingstar Recruitment Agency
content:
Risingstar Recruitment Agency is an experienced HR Firm, recruiting entry-level, mid-level and top management staff.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Female Admin Officer

Job Location: Tafewa Balewa Square, Lagos
Slots: 2
Work Days: Monday to Friday

Summary


	A well-known logistics company located at TBS, Lagos is urgently hiring two (2) Female Admin Officers to join their team.


Requirements
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Strong administrative and organizational skills
	Good communication and computer proficiency
	Must be smart, proactive, and professional


Remuneration


	Salary: N170,000 Monthly.
	Benefits: Additional incentives and other company benefits.


Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) Nanny

Job Location: Osapa / Jakande Lekki - Lagos

Requirements


	Must be caring, patient, and trustworthy
	Experience with children is preferred
	Must reside around Osapa/Jakande (No accommodation provided)
	Ready to resume immediately


Salary
N60,000 / Month

Click here to apply online

Note: No accommodation provided.

 

 

3.) Female School Administrator

Job Locations: Osapa, Jakande, & Lekki - Lagos

Requirements


	Must be organized, responsible, and professional
	Experience in school administration is preferred
	Must reside around Osapa/Jakande (No accommodation provided)
	Ready to resume immediately.


Salary
N80,000 - N100,000 / month

Click here to apply online    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "General Manager",
  "description": "At TeamAce, we help businesses across different industries thrive. We work with businesses to create their desired change by getting the right people, designing bespoke business processes, leveraging data, applying insights and technology. We combine our expertise and take different bespoke approaches to solve different business challenges because we believe there is no one size fits all approach. This way, you keep your eyes on the price and thrive.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: General Manager
Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time&nbsp;(Onsite)
Industry: Facility Management
Reports to: Chief Executive Officer (CEO)

Job Summary


	Our client seeks an experienced General Manager to oversee three entities in Facility Management (Cleaning Services) and Events/Gifting (Surprises &amp; Experience) industries.
	The ideal candidate must have solid GM experience, strong leadership skills, and the ability to drive growth, profitability, and operational excellence across all business units.


Key Responsibilities


	Oversee daily operations and ensure efficiency across entities.
	Develop and execute growth and marketing strategies.
	Supervise team leads and align goals with company objectives.
	Monitor budgets, performance, and compliance.
	Lead recruitment, training, and performance management.
	Present reports and insights to the CEO.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree (MBA or certification is an advantage).
	3 - 5 years of proven General Manager experience.
	Strong financial, leadership, and business development skills.
	Excellent communication and problem-solving ability.
	Strategic, organized, and results-driven.


Salary
N500,000 - N700,000 Monthly (Net)",

General Manager Job at TeamAce Limited




        
    

        
        At TeamAce, we help businesses across different industries thrive. We work with businesses to create their desired change by getting the right people, designing bespoke business processes, leveraging data, applying insights and technology. We combine our expertise and take different bespoke approaches to solve different business challenges because we believe there is no one size fits all approach. This way, you keep your eyes on the price and thrive.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: General Manager
Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time (Onsite)
Industry: Facility Management
Reports to: Chief Executive Officer (CEO)
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Summary


	Our client seeks an experienced General Manager to oversee three entities in Facility Management (Cleaning Services) and Events/Gifting (Surprises & Experience) industries.
	The ideal candidate must have solid GM experience, strong leadership skills, and the ability to drive growth, profitability, and operational excellence across all business units.


Key Responsibilities


	Oversee daily operations and ensure efficiency across entities.
	Develop and execute growth and marketing strategies.
	Supervise team leads and align goals with company objectives.
	Monitor budgets, performance, and compliance.
	Lead recruitment, training, and performance management.
	Present reports and insights to the CEO.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree (MBA or certification is an advantage).
	3 - 5 years of proven General Manager experience.
	Strong financial, leadership, and business development skills.
	Excellent communication and problem-solving ability.
	Strategic, organized, and results-driven.


Salary
N500,000 - N700,000 Monthly (Net)    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

title: Job Openings at Brit Properties Nigeria Limited
content:
Brit Properties Nigeria Limited is a property development company incorporated in Nigeria by Companies and Allied Matters Act. Our primary business interests are land, infrastructure/property development, land survey, property marketing and estate agency. We strive to provide exceptional customer service while offering our clients the best property options. We are committed to making good property decision for both existing and potential clients.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Sales Executive

Job Location: Enugu
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	This is a full-time on-site role located in Enugu State, Nigeria for a Sales Executive.
	As a Sales Executive, you will be responsible for driving property sales and providing excellent customer service to our clients.
	This includes promoting and marketing properties, conducting property visits, negotiating and closing sales deals, and maintaining strong relationships with clients.


Qualifications


	Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, or a related field is preferred.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills
	Proven experience in sales, preferably in real estate or property industry
	Excellent negotiation and closing skills
	Ability to work independently and meet sales targets
	Knowledge of the local property market and customer preferences
	Proficiency in using CRM software and other sales tools
	Highly motivated and goal-oriented


Salary
N50,000 - N100,000 Monthly.

Application Closing Date: 13th November, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: chukwu.vincent@britproperties.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email. 

 


2.) Sales Advisor

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Description


	This is a full-time hybrid role for a Sales Advisor based in Lagos.
	As a Sales Advisor, you will be responsible for managing customer inquiries, providing excellent customer service, conducting property tours, generating and following up on leads, and achieving sales targets.
	The role includes maintaining relationships with clients and providing training to customers on property-related products. Some work from home is acceptable.


Qualifications


	Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or a related field
	Strong Interpersonal Skills and Communication skills
	Excellent Customer Service abilities
	Proven skills in Sales and Training
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team
	Prior experience in real estate or property development is a plus
	Good organizational and time management skills.


Application Closing Date: 10th November, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: chukwu.vincent@britproperties.ng using "Sales Advisor" as the subject of the email. 

 

 

3.) Compliance Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Ensure adherence to local labor laws, employment regulations, and statutory requirements (PF, ESI, gratuity, minimum wages, etc.)
	Monitor and implement regulatory changes affecting HR and workforce management
	Conduct regular audits of employee records, contracts, and statutory documentation
	Ensure contractor and subcontractor labor compliance at project/construction sites
	Coordinate with external auditors, labor consultants, and government agencies
	Draft, review, and update HR policies and ensure consistent implementation across departments and sites
	Train HR team members, managers, and site supervisors on compliance-related matters
	Prepare compliance reports for internal and external stakeholders


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources, Law, Business Administration, or a related field (Master’s or LLB preferred)
	2 – 3 years of experience in HR compliance, preferably in real estate, infrastructure, or manufacturing
	Strong knowledge of employment laws and labor regulations
	Experience handling labor compliance at project or construction sites is a strong advantage
	Excellent attention to detail, strong organizational skills, and high ethical standards
	Proficient in MS Office and HRMS/statutory compliance tools
	Candidate must reside in or around the Ajah axis.


Salary
N150,000 Monthly.

Application Closing Date: 19th November, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: Onedibe.kosisochukwu@britproperties.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email. 

 

 

4.) Talent Acquisition Officer

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Partner with department heads and HR to identify hiring needs and plan workforce requirements.
	Develop and implement effective talent acquisition strategies that align with company goals.
	Source, screen, and interview candidates using multiple recruitment platforms and techniques.
	Build and maintain a strong talent pipeline to meet hiring targets (including 4,250 salespeople).
	Manage onboarding and ensure smooth integration of new hires.
	Support initiatives to improve employee engagement and retention.
	Promote the company’s employer brand through job fairs, social media, and other recruitment events.
	Champion diversity and inclusion in all recruitment activities.
	Monitor and report on recruitment metrics such as time-to-fill, cost-per-hire, and quality-of-hire.
	Ensure compliance with labor laws and recruitment best practices.
	Achieve at least one direct sale per quarter as part of performance objectives.
	Perform other duties as assigned.


Salary
N138,000 / month. 

Application Closing Date: 1st December, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: Onedibe.kosisochukwu@britproperties.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

     

    

        Click here to Apply

	Meet and exceed sales target
	Ensure high level of customers&#39; satisfaction through excellent service.
	Propose innovative ideas to increase market share.
	Conduct personnel performance appraisals to assess training needs and build career paths.
	Directs store operations including retail operations, customer service, managing employees and sales.
	Develop business strategies to raise our customers&rsquo; pool, expand store traffic and optimize profitability.
	Assess local Markets conditions and identify current and prospective sales opportunities.

	Maintain outstanding store condition and visual merchandising standards
	Responsible for maintaining an acceptable gross profit, proper inventory management and reporting of store activities.
	Report on buying trends, customer needs, profits, etc


Requirements


	BSc Degree / HND in Business Administration or relevant field.
	A minimum of three years of managerial work experience in the retail industry.
	Must have run and manage a supermarket before.
	Customer service-oriented with in-depth knowledge of basic business management processes.
	Strong organizational skills
	Attention to Details and Numerical Skills.
	Demonstrable Skills and Technical Competence.
	Interested applicants must be of high integrity.
	Possess good communication and interpersonal skills.


Benefits

	Sales Commission
	13th Month.

Assistant Supermarket Manager Job at Quest Employment




        
    

        
        Quest Employment - Our client is one of the leading name in the supermarket/retail industry.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Assistant Supermarket Manager
Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos

Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Meet and exceed sales target
	Ensure high level of customers' satisfaction through excellent service.
	Propose innovative ideas to increase market share.
	Conduct personnel performance appraisals to assess training needs and build career paths.
	Directs store operations including retail operations, customer service, managing employees and sales.
	Develop business strategies to raise our customers’ pool, expand store traffic and optimize profitability.
	Assess local Markets conditions and identify current and prospective sales opportunities.
	Complete store administration and ensure compliance with policies and procedures
	Bring out the best of branch’s personnel through training, coaching, development and motivation.
	Maintain outstanding store condition and visual merchandising standards
	Responsible for maintaining an acceptable gross profit, proper inventory management and reporting of store activities.
	Report on buying trends, customer needs, profits, etc


Requirements


	BSc Degree / HND in Business Administration or relevant field.
	A minimum of three years of managerial work experience in the retail industry.
	Must have run and manage a supermarket before.
	Customer service-oriented with in-depth knowledge of basic business management processes.
	Strong organizational skills
	Attention to Details and Numerical Skills.
	Demonstrable Skills and Technical Competence.
	Interested applicants must be of high integrity.
	Possess good communication and interpersonal skills.


Benefits


	Salary: N200,000 - N300,000 Monthly.
	Pension
	HMO
	Feeding
	Sales Commission
	13th Month.
